results.description:
This Meetup is intended for intermediate level players or higher, which means:Yankee C and above level, players with firm understanding of game strategy. Should be able to play 5-1 and 6-2 formations, have a good grasp of skills (passing, setting, hitting) and be able to move around to cover areas of the court. Play should consistently be bump-set-spike.



If you'd like to play, please do the following:


1. Send an email to Kory using the following URL: http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=8675200

2. In the message please indicate the date of event and your preferred position so we can make sure we have the right mix. ( If I don't know your position already)

Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. We will do our best to make sure the event is co-ed, have setters,  and incorporate a couple new members who want to join as well.

The location for this volleyball meetup is at the Orient Heights Community Center located at 86 Boardman Street in East Boston. Kory and Wing will be hosting these Tuesday night volleyball meetups.

This event is free if you are a member of Boston Community Centers. If not, it's a one-time $20 membership fee that is valid for a year. The Community Center is a short walk away from the Orient Heights T Stop on the Blue Line and also has plenty of parking. When you drive up, turn at the Mariott Hotel Sign and park in the lot or further along the fence.

As always, please remember:

- Respect the RSVP system (Don't show up expecting to play without a confirmed RSVP)

- The gym is open before the event to warm up, so please arrive a little early if you would like to warm up and stretch as we would like to start the game promptly from 7:00PM

- If it looks like you won't be able to make it or will run late please cancel your RSVP in time for someone else to join.  Event day/last minute cancellations and no shows will jeopardize your participation in future events.
results.name: 8/25 Intermediate+ Indoor Volleyball East Boston

results.description:
Social In Boston Presents:

BOSTON ROOF DECKS TOUR

The Summer of 2015 is going to be a great one for the members of Social In Boston! One part of what makes it so great is our weekly roof deck tour. Each and every Saturday we'll be visiting a different roof deck for food, drinks, relaxation, and socializing. Please the details carefully every week, as the details are going to change. Some venues have better times to visit than others, and as already stated, each week will be in a different location...

Our Twelfth Stop...

We are breaking tradition and doing a new Roof Deck event on a Tuesday night because they are not available at 12 on Saturdays. Kaori, I made this one for you. ; )

Dive into the invigorating waters of the roof top pool, and see how refreshing the Hotel Indigo Boston-Newton Riverside can really be. The stylish pool is a chic nighttime hot spot, with luxury cabanas offering the perfect setting for a sleek summertime soirée. Let's escape from the heat with a revitalizing dip, chill out on the relaxation deck, taste some spirits from the bar, discover a world of laid-back indulgence, and immerse ourselves in the fresh vibe of Hotel Indigo in Newton!

Check out the Bokx 109 menu.

Join us on the beautiful roof deck, complete with an indoor bar and plenty of space. : )

GETTING THERE

Hotel Indigo is at 399 Grove St, Newton, MA, 02462.

Click here for directions on Google.Plenty of parking is available at the hotel.

Take the T D Green Line all the way to the end to the Riverside/Newtonstop, walk 3 minutes to Hotel Indigo.

See you there Socialites!

~Matt
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us on the Roof Deck! : )

results.description:
Based on a traditional English pub sing, but with a bit of an American flavor, this session meets each 4th Tuesday (except in January), and is open to all singers who want to join in.  Pub singing emphasizes spontaneity, rich harmonies, a sweep-you-along sense of communal participation, and (above all) energetic joy.  We love the fine old drinking songs and know plenty of sea chanteys and chorus songs from the British Isles and New England, but anything goes as long as it's fun and has a chorus or refrain that people can pick up.  Bring a song to share!

Start time for the singing is 7PM, but some arrive early to have dinner.  We'll be in the cafe, where they have soup, sandwiches and desserts, as well as wine and a nice variety of bottled beers.

Getting there: http://artsatthearmory.net/about/getting-here/
The Café: http://artsatthearmory.net/cafe/

IMPORTANT NOTE #1: We have to stop singing at 9:30PM sharp.

IMPORTANT NOTE #2: This sing is not solely a Meetup group event, and takes place even if nobody from Meetup says they are attending.  About one to two dozen (or more) people typically show up.
results.name: Armory Pub Sing - August 2015

results.description:
Camera settings and facial expressions are all useful things to know when making portraits but unless you know how to pose your subject the resulting photograph can look totally wrong.

While I have taught introductory classes on posing this is the first time I have offered an in-depth intensive series on posing that presents in  a systematic approach  the accumulated skill and knowledge of over forty years of experience. 

It goes way beyond anything you learned in the  introductory class.

The workshop takes place over three Tuesday evening  sessions: 

Aug 18 individual poses - the spine and the feet which are the key to good poses

August 25  hands, arms, shoulders and heads - the fine tuning

Sept 1 - couples and groups  - putting it all together 

The cost is $125 for the three sessions and class size is limited.

(You must sign up for the series - attending individual classes is not an option as the series presents a unique posing system where knowledge of the previous class will be necessary for the understanding of the subsequent classes).
results.how_to_find_us: Enter through the EMTS inc. Door and head to the 2nd floor
results.name: Professional Posing Techniques - workshop Seriesj

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships

 

 


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.


Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time. I have very limited access to the internet and that can make it difficult for me to respond to emails. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

 

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

These classes are not affiliated with any church or religion.
results.name: Healing the Loss of a Love - Attracting a Healthy and Loving Relationship

results.description:
Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.
results.how_to_find_us: Once up the stairs, turn around to your left, and go in the door that is mostly glass panes
results.name: Mindfulness Meditation

results.description:
Awaken the Healing Power within Your Body and Mind


·  Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing power

·  Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships

·  Learn to work constructively with your own emotions

·  Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities

·  Develop new resources and capabilities

·  Become clear about your life’s purpose

Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.

Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.

Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses

Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.

Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.

Discover the passion and power that resides within you

Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind

We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.

Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.

Alternate Tuesdays at 7:30 PM at Unity of Somerville, located at 6 William Street at the corner of College Avenue

Call (913)[masked] to learn more

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
How does a TennisNorthEast Season / League run?

The league advertises the season dates and builds a queue of committed players for the season.

Kickoff Day - August 26th

The start day of the season, players are sent a kickoff email that contains important information about the league, the link where your league standings and players contact information. We guarantee 6 playing partners at your playing level, but have been averaging closer to 15+ partners in most cities.

Your Task - "Flexible Scheduling"

After this kickoff email is sent, it is the player's task to communicate with other players. Players should work with their partners to find an agreeable time and location to play the match. While TennisNorthEast doesn't mandate your playing schedule, it is recommended that players schedule at least one match per week. By request of the players, we started to allow players to play 1 rematch per season. The regular season is all about playing as much as you can. As of Jan. 1st, 2013 we've had 189 players play more than 20 matches in a season.

Where to Play?

Play at your local free tennis courts, tennis parks, condo courts or tennis clubs. The league strongly suggests that players jointly try to pick a tennis court location convenient to both. We provide an extensive list of tennis courts, including # of courts, lighting, hitting walls, etc. We strive to keep this list up-to-date.

TennisNorthEast sets up a must play dates to push players out on the courts. The final deadline is the date marking the end of the season, at which point players with 5 wins will qualify for a post-season playoff to determine the league champion.

How to Play?

Players can use three semi-standard playing formats: 2 out of 3 sets, 2 sets with 10 point super tie-breaker or the 10-game pro set (First to 10, used when court time is limited).

Playoffs

Each season concludes with a playoffs where players with anywhere from 3 to 5 season wins qualifies for a single elimination tourney.  The champion is awarded based upon the league Prize Pool. Each singles league champion also receives a playing entry into the National Tourney which is already scheduled for Crandon Park Tennis Center in Key Biscayne - Nov. 13-15, 2015.

Join Today!!

Full price is $34.95 to play in a season, BUT the earlier you sign up we typically offer discounts during these tougher economic times. Just go to the Join Page and complete the short form. We'd be happy to find you dedicated tennis playing partners.


Do you know to sign up for this season you go to: http://TennisNorthEast.com/join

results.description:
Join us and explore the virtual universe created by Surreal, a NYC based VR studio. Learn about how smart glasses and AR can be used to help people with autism from Brain Power, a Boston based company. 

Surreal is the first fully immersive virtual universe for VR, where players engage in real-time adventures with their friends, in and out of this world. Soar over Manhattan at dawn in your own futuristic drone transport, or ride the dragon and survey your medieval kingdom. Dance the night away or just kick back in the hot tub and talk about your day. Unless of course you want to explore the Rings of Saturn, or find a dragon egg in the sacred forest and hatch it. We'll keep you entertained, whether you want to ride with Genghis Khan or dance to Chaka Khan. See:  http://surre.al/


Brain Power - The World's First Wearable System for Autism

The award-winning Brain Power System is an augmented reality toolset that helps people with autism work toward their own customized goals for happy self-sufficiency. (http://www.Brain-Power.com)  The focus is on teaching language (with multi-lingual support), interview skills, control of behaviors, physiology-triggered cues to relax yourself, and the like, which would be fun for anyone. We choose smart glasses and AR as opposed to VR (or phones or tablets), in order to keep the person with autism looking up and at people in his or her world. Brain power is platform-independent and portable to all the new smart glasses. Google called it  the most creative and impactful use of Google Glass. It has been featured in TechCrunch, WIRED and almost 200 media outlets.

Presentation by Dr. Ned T. Sahin, Brain Power CEO  http://www.nedsahin.com/about/professional-bio/   See videos:

• http://bpwr.co/bp_loveU2_pieces

• http://bpwr.co/bp_launch_event

• http://bpwr.co/bp_plymouth_arc


PLEASE NOTE: our venue requires that all guests RSVP with their full name on meetup.com. You will be asked for a photo ID at the security desk. RSVP's from incomplete names or nicknames will be removed from the list before the event and will not be allowed access to the event. Thanks in advance for your cooperation!


Schedule

6 - Doors open, demos begin, pizza is served courtesy of Brain Power & Surreal!

7 - 7:30 - Brain Power Presentation

7:30 - 8 - Surreal Presentation

8 - 8:15 - Demo intros & announcements

8:15 - 9:45 Demofest!!

9:45pm - Come with us to the afterparty at Firebrand Saints (it's right downstairs!!) 


Parking

If you're coming to the afterparty, Firebrand Saints offers free validated parking for entry after 5pm. Enter through the garage and then keep going into the parking lot so you don't have to go through security again after the garage closes. Please note that the validation is temporary; once they swipe your ticket you should exit the lot immediately.
results.name: Surreal & Brain Power

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

A number of folks living NORTH of Boston have asked about an ASL SOCIAL. Let's make this happen!

On WEDNESDAYS, starting October 29 - 6pm to 8pm - I / we will be at the NORTH SHORE MALL Food Court.

While technology has improved the way people communicate, "Deaf Social Clubs" are slowly disappearing. This is a way to start bringing REAL social interaction back!

Please join us for a casual, relaxed, no-pressure two-hour Social, where we can chat, tell stories, get to know each other, and meet new people (or old friends!). Friends, Fun and Food!

A warm welcome is extended to all Deaf & non-Deaf people: folks in the Deaf Community, CODA's, Interpreters, ASL students, parents of deaf children AND their children, ASL professors/teachers, Relay Operators, Deaf services workers- EVERYONE!

This will be a "SOME ASL KNOWLEDGE and ABOVE" Social, because not all of us are ASL-fluent! "Voices- Off" -- we'll all laugh & learn WITH and FROM each other!

WHAT: ASL SOCIAL CLUB
WHERE: North Shore Mall Food Court, PEABODY,MA
DAY/TIME: Wednesdays, 6pm - 8pm
WHY: To meet like-minded people, socialize using ASL, tell stories, and have good time!
WHO: Anyone who wants to chat using American Sign Language!
HOW TO FIND US:  We'll be sitting on the couches closest to the "walkway" side of the Food Court, not hidden inside the food court, so easier to locate us!

results.description:
The process of modeling a stock’s returns through macroeconomic factors (factor modeling) is widely implemented in finance. Factor models can be used to determine your algorithm’s exposure to risk, or to construct arbitrage strategies. An example of a factor model could be using the price of oil, treasury rate, and a national stability index to predict the returns of every stock in the S&P 500.

During this meetup, we will discuss how to implement factor models and different ways they can be useful for strategy research and design.

This talk is part of Quantopian’s Summer Lecture Series. We are currently developing a quant finance curriculum and will be releasing clone-able notebooks and algorithms to go along with this lecture. 

Pizza and beer will be served.

Speaker Details

Delaney Granizo-Mackenzie will be presenting. Delaney is an engineer at Quantopian whose focus is on how Quantopian can be used as a teaching tool. After studying computer science at Princeton, Delaney joined Quantopian in 2014. Since then he has led successful course integrations at MIT Sloan and Stanford, and is planning on expanding to many more schools this fall. Delaney’s background includes 7 years of academic research at a bioinformatics lab, and a strong focus on statistics and machine learning. 

Want to learn more about Quantopian? Visit us at: www.quantopian.com.

results.name: Quantopian Summer Lecture: What’s in Your Returns?

results.description:
Join us on August 26 for an exciting and fun evening of networking at Boston AEF’s mixer for like-minded entrepreneurial professionals. We will have a panel presentation and interview with our special guest, Kenneth Fan, who will talk to us about his experiences starting Addgene. There will be food and non-alcoholic drinks provided.

About Kenneth

Kenneth is a co-founder of Addgene, a nonprofit organization dedicated to making it easier for scientists to share plasmids. Kenneth received his Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Engineering from Tufts University and his Master of Arts in Law and Diplomacy, with a focus on international technology management, from the Fletcher School at Tufts.

About Addgene

Addgene is a nonprofit organization that helps scientists archive, store, and distribute their plasmids. Plasmids are highly versatile DNA-based tools used by biomedical researchers in a broad range of applications. Researchers around the world use Addgene’s plasmids to study diseases such as cancer, diabetes, and Parkinson’s. Check out this video to learn more!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?t=30&v=tDdZMGLo9wY

results.description:
While harsh words by Paula Deen, Ronald Sterling, and Cliven Bundy have rocked white America in the past year, these isolated events reflect an older, more tangible form of racism. Meanwhile, the more powerful antagonist, modern, or ‘elegant,’ racism goes largely unnoticed. Waking Up White, a new book by racial justice educator Debby Irving, provides critical context that allows white people to quickly grasp modern racism’s inner workings and enter into conversations with new awareness and skill.

Waking Up White functions as both a “Racism 101” for white people and a rare exposé on whiteness for people of color. The book is a catalytic kick-starter that provides people of all colors and levels of racial awareness with the language and tools necessary to enter into cross-racial conversations about race within a less threatening context. For white readers wanting to further their own awakening, Irving includes short prompts and exercises at the end of each chapter.

“When I finally came to understand the way racism worked,” she explains, “I spent a lot of time thinking about what might have enlightened me earlier. I decided it wouldn’t have been an academic book, an essay, or a book from the perspective of a person of color -- it would have been another white person describing their own awakening, with some humor, poignancy and drama in the mix. What I needed was a memoir so irresistible that I would have read it even if racism weren’t on my mind.”

Join us at the Hub for a conversation with Debby on Wednesday, August 26.
results.name: Debby Irving: Waking Up White

It doesn't matter if you are an expert "planeswalker", or don't know anything about Magic: The Gathering -- you can come to play or learn this amazing strategy game.  There are usually between 6-12 people at each event, consisting of all experience levels.  All decks of all types are welcome for this "casual play" event.  Beginners who want to learn are welcome!

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that MTG Boston members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.

results.description:
More Great Speeches: Wed, Aug 26.

Did you ever imagine speaking could be fun?

Our last Meet-ups won rave reviews from first-time guests. They enjoyed the simple exercises and learned useful techniques for connecting with an audience.

Our meet-ups are fast-paced and entertaining. Nobody feels intimidated. Come experience it for yourself: You'll get to listen to prepared speeches and learn simple yet effective speaking tips.


You are welcome to participate in our two-minute impromptu speaking exercises, but certainly not required. We do have a 30-second “Round Robin” that everyone participates in (it’s fun and easy), and you’ll probably be asked to introduce yourself [talk very briefly about an interest, or what brought you there]. Pretty basic, no surprises.  The only requirement is to enjoy yourself and get a sense of how the meet-ups run. [They start promptly at 6:50, so please arrive by 6:45. They end by 8:30 pm.]


Mark Your Calendar - Our Next Meet-Ups:


Sat, Aug 29 (9:45 AM)
Wed, Sept 9, (6:45 PM)

3rd Floor, Room 103. You must take the elevator by the security desk to access the floor.

Parking: If you can't find street parking (free after 6 PM), There is parking to the rear of the bldg. You will present ticket to the security desk on your way out ($3), then insert the ticket at the gate as you exit.
(Don't park in the supermarket/Porter Square shopping center parking lot.)


See the "About Us" tab for more info.

results.description:
Pentesting automation is hard, but I'll show you how to do it for websites, using a high-level Quality Assurance tool called Lettuce. Lettuce is a Python tool for automating browsers, based on Selenium, using Behavior Driven Development (BDD) to run a Given-When-Then (GWT) script. The following prerequisites work on any machine: Mac, Windows, Linux. For this workshop, you must use Virtualbox... no Parallels, no VMWare, no Hyper-V, etc.

Prerequisites:

- install Virtualbox https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads

- install Virtualbox Extensions Pack https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads


- download Kali Linux 2.0 VM 64-bit https://www.offensive-security.com/kali-linux-vmware-arm-image-download/

- install Vagrant http://www.vagrantup.com/downloads.html


- clone Railsgoat https://github.com/OWASP/railsgoat

- vagrant up Railsgoat https://github.com/OWASP/railsgoat#vagrant-install

PLEASE DO ALL OF THE PREREQUISITES BEFORE COMING TO THE EVENT

Workshop schedule:

- overview of website edge-case testing

- overview of HTTP request structure

- install Selenium http://www.seleniumhq.org/download/

- install Lettuce http://lettuce.it/tutorial/simple.html

- simple test script

- setup Burpsuite Proxy for monitoring


- Attack!

- review Burpsuite log

results.description:
An evening of gut-wrenching live readings from Jessica Bebenek, JC Bouchard, dalton derkson, JM Francheteau, and Julie Mannell. Their limited-edition chapbook will also be available for sale.

Worst Case Ontario is a collaboration between five young Canadian poets and writers who one day dreamed a dream of stuffing themselves into a rented sedan and etching a route between any outpost in Canada and the States that would allow them a mic and the time to go to work. We think that literature is built by new voices, diverse voices, voices that seek to break and won’t be broken.

ABOUT THE POETS:

JESSICA BEBENEK is a Toronto poet and writer currently living in Montreal. Her writing appears in Prairie Fire, Grain, The Puritan, and Little Brother, among other places. She is the founder of the micro-press Grow & Gsrow and the author of three chapbooks, most recently Kettle Song. This fall, she begins an MA in English & Creative Writing at Concordia University to continue work on her first full collection of poetry, tentatively titled No One Knows Us There. But mainly right now she knits. For more information: www.jessicabebenek.com

JC BOUCHARD was born in Elliot Lake, a former mining town in northern Ontario. His poetry has appeared in Arc, untethered, In/Words, (parenthetical), Rappahannock Review, Control, and more. One of his poems was long-listed for the CBC Poetry Prize and another received Honourable Mention for the John Newlove Poetry Award from Bywords. He is the author of two chapbooks: Portraits (In/Words Press), and Wool Water (words(on)pages), forthcoming in Fall 2015. He lives in Toronto. DALTON DERKSON is a punk poet from the prairies, currently residing in Toronto. He runs Hurtin’ Crüe Press, a D.I.Y. collective through which he promotes fellow Canadian poets and self-publishes too many chapbooks. Upon arriving in the city, he was superkicked by The Party Animal and quite frankly, his poems haven’t been the same since. For proof, check out his recent work in ottawater, SPANK the CARP, and In/Words magazine or find him on Twitter @dirtyderk.

JM FRANCHETEAU is a rural transplant based in Ottawa, ON. His writing has appeared mostly recently in CV2, Arc, Broken Pencil and untethered, and his second chapbook, kids, is out with Hurtin’ Crüe Press. He cowrites the zine Nightshift and organizes the Ottawa Zine Off! series. For more information: www.jmfrancheteau.wordpress.com

JULIE MANNELL is a Montreal-based writer of prose, poetry, and essays, originally from Fonthill, Ontario. Mannell currently writes for The Huffington Post, and her work has appeared in several journals, magazines, and textbooks. She is the recipient of the Lionel Shapiro Award for Excellency in Creative Writing and The Mona Adilman Poetry Prize. Mannell founded the McGill Creative Writing Society where she facilitated workshops and panels for three years. In 2012 Roseanne Barr gave Mannell the Vagenius Award. Visit www.juliemannell.com and follow her on Twitter @juliemannell.

The Worst Case Ontario chapbook will be available for purchase during event.
results.name: Worst Case Ontario Poetry Reading Tour: Best Case Boston

results.description:
Most Wednesdays we gather for an open gaming night at the Panera in Porter Square. This event is open to anyone, and usually doesn't have any sort of pre-arranged agenda -- anything you can bring is fair game, provided you can get it done in three hours!

* Your gallant host almost always brings something to play, and takes requests if you get said request to him by Tuesday night at the latest. Behold the collection: http://www.bgg.cc/collection/user/CmdrOverbite?gallery=large&rankobjecttype=subtype&rankobjectid=1&columns=title%7Cstatus%7Cversion%7Crating%7Cbggrating%7Cplays%7Ccomment%7Ccommands&geekranks=%0A%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09Board+Game+Rank%0A%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09&own=1&objecttype=thing&ff=1&subtype=boardgame

* Due to logistical concerns and a desire to keep peace with the management (who have been notably chill thus far about a bunch of freeloading nerds taking up their table space), I have set a limit of twelve attendees on these events going forward. I doubt this will be much of an issue, given our typical attendance numbers.

* Because our events tend to be small, and the games we typically play tend to be long, if at all possible, please let us know if you plan to be more than a couple of minutes late so that we don't launch into something without you. Likewise, if you're planning on arriving more than a half-hour late, you should be aware that it may not be possible to include you in a game. You're welcome to come by and hang out but the chances are better than even that we'll be hip-deep in gaming goodness by the time you arrive.

* Please be respectful of our hosts; stay mindful of closing time and throw 'em some business if you're hungry.

* Have fun and roll high!

RAIN DATE is August 27, same time and place.

Felix Mendelssohn composed incidental music for Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream, including the famous wedding music. The Commonwealth Shakespeare Company and the Boston Landmarks Orchestra are teaming up to present the play and the music together at the Hatch Shell. Can they stay synchronized? Will Hippolyta crack up? Will these mortals be fools? Come and find out!

Bring a blanket or low beach-type chair, a brown bag supper, and perhaps bug spray. When you RSVP you'll get Sylvia's cell no. so that you can locate the group when you arrive.

results.description:
Welcome to our regular meetup!  We are a casual group of people who enjoy playing board games -- specifically, the kind of board games that make you think.  We play a variety of games, most of which are Euro style games of medium complexity.

This season, in addition to playing games, we will be raffling off a bunch of popular games!  There will be raffles at each meetup. Simply by showing up, you'll get a chance to win free games. The more often you come, the more entries you'll receive.

Our weekly meetup is in a TERRIFIC space for games steps from the Kendall Square T, with easy parking, and lots of room to spread out in.  Full directions are below.  The building door does get locked in the evening, but there is plenty of foot traffic in and out.  If you expect to arrive later than 8:30, send Tucker a message ahead of time, and we'll make sure someone is there to let you in.

Our meetups happen once a week (alternating Mondays and Wednesdays), from 7:00 pm until 11:00 pm or later.

Our group has been running since 2007, and at this point we have a pretty large crowd of regulars.  A lot of people come once every few weeks, and RSVPs are appreciated but not required, so the RSVP list is often smaller than our actual attendance.  We expect about 30-45 people at most of our meetups.

We play whatever people bring, which typically includes a lot of Euros.  Here's a "tip of the iceberg" look at a few games that have been popular lately:

7 Wonders, Terra Mystica, Race for the Galaxy, Splendor, One Night Werewolf, Le Havre, Hansa Teutonica, Machi Koro, Concordia, Super Big Boggle

As you can see, there is some real variety.  A few of our regular attendees bring about 20-30 games between them, so there's always a lot to choose from.  But if you have a game you like, just bring it with you!

People new to Euros are very welcome.  But be aware that you are NOT likely to find traditional American games (like Monopoly, Sorry, Risk, or Poker); the heaviest strategy games (like 18xx or wargames); or pure abstract games (like Chess).

Finally, a note about Settlers of Catan and Carcassonne.  These are traditional "gateway games" that many people play when they first discover Euros.  Although you will occasionally find those games at our meetups, many of us have played them to death and have become more interested in games with a little more complexity to them.

OUTBOUND (from Boston / from Park Street)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the front of the train. Cross the street. (If you take the escalator up, turn around first to see the street.) After crossing, proceed behind the T entrance (perpendicular to Main Street).  Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

INBOUND (from Alewife / Porter / Harvard / Central)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the rear of the train. Take the stairs or elevator straight up. Proceed straight ahead (perpendicular to Main Street). Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

FROM BOSTON (or Memorial Drive)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading north (cross the river if coming from Boston).  Memorial Drive is the first cross street past the river; go past it.
2) Take the first right, onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the first right after Memorial Drive.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

FROM CAMBRIDGE (or points west)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading south.
2) Take a left onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the last left before Memorial Drive; there is a railroad crossing there.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

Once you enter, Room 119 is just past the stairs on the right. There is a suggested donation of $1.00 that goes towards site fees and party supplies.  (You will also receive extra raffle tickets any time you donate.)

Feel free to email with any questions -- we hope to see you at a meetup soon.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk a quarter of a block from the Kendall T, in the opposite direction from the Marriott Plaza. We're in the big building on your right (across from the parking lot). When you enter, our room is just across the foyer and on your right.

results.description:
Welcome to the weekly BKBS Wednesday meet up. Please join us at 7:00 PM by the 3rd table station in the middle of the top roping / lead area. If you are still by the bouldering wall, keep on walking.

We usually meet there for about 10 mins, and then team up in groups of 2 or 3 for top-rope climbing.

If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

BKBS (http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before climbing on the ropes. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need?  You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time?  Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.how_to_find_us: The third table in the middle of the climbing area between 7:00-7:10 PM. It's the table in the middle of the TR \/ Lead area.
results.name: Brooklyn Boulders Somerville Wednesday

results.description:
This is a free meditation session, and an introduction to the Art of Living course, meant to bring people together for a few moments of perfect tranquility in the heart of Cambridge. Join us as we practice meditation and mindfulness, and hang around later to interact with like-minded people over a relaxing cup of tea. These sessions are being offered by the Art of Living Foundation, a non-profit organization engaged in service initiatives across 153 countries. So, come, empty your minds, and fill up your teacups!

No meditation experience required, all are welcome. Please RSVP!

results.name: Meditation and Tea

results.description:
Please join us Weds August 26th at 7pm for some Full Moon Magic!

Sophia is the Gnostic Goddess of Holy Wisdom; she is the mother of creation, praised among classical philosophers, Hebrews and early Christians.  We will gather in her honor and embrace her mysteries as we reflect on her wisdom and guidance. 


We will begin gathering at 7pm and begin ritual promptly at 7:30pm (once doors to the ritual space are closed, out of respect for other ritual goers enterance will not be allowed). 

Time for fellowship and socializing to follow. 

This ritual is open to all experience levels, from novice to adept and is by DONATION, which will be collected after ritual, please give what you can to cover costs of room rental and supplies.
results.name: Full Moon Ritual to Sophia

venue.name: Center for Arts at the Armory

results.description:
Hey TurnON Boston folks - we've got a special night planned for you all! Come and join us for an evening of fun games and a different format from our usual TurnON.

The games will be led by Liz Markle, founder of the Boston OM Community (visiting from California!). For those of you who remember the early days of TurnON Boston, we don't need to tell you how great this is going to be. And for those of you who weren't around back then - come out and join the fun!

The games we play (all clothes on, no contact) will give you the opportunity to look deeper into yourself in a playful, genuine way, and connect authentically with the other people around you.

TurnON Boston is an organization that teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. At the end of the evening, we will give you a brief description of the practice of Orgasmic Meditation and information on where to learn more.

Please aim to arrive by 7:20!

>>>Free for Cambridge and Boston Singles members!<<<

We will be located on the Mezzanine - walk straight back through the large double doors! Also, free parking in the Armory's lot, behind the building!
results.name: The Orgasm Games! Interactive lecture & games with the Boston OM community

results.description:
This Meetup is intended for Intermediate/Advanced Intermediate level players with firm understanding of game strategy. Should be able to have a good grasp of skills (passing, setting, hitting) and be able to move around to cover areas of the court. Play should consistently be bump-set-spike. If you'd like to play, please do the following: Click RSVP or send an email to Alan using the following URL:

http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=186541038

Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. We will do our best to make sure the event is co-ed, have setters, and incorporate a couple new members who want to join as well. The location for this volleyball meetup is at the JCC of the North Shore, 4 Community Road, Marblehead, MA[masked] | Home Page:

http://www.jccns.org/adult-volleyball/

This event is free if you are a member of JCC. If not, it's a one-time $10 membership fee that is valid for a day. results.description:
Experience Source : Experience You 

We are returning back to Source ~ to who we truly are! 

Soul Tone can assist you on your journey!

Are your ready to Experience Source : Experience You?

http://static.wixstatic.com/media/b8a075_78f5c0ebbcbe472db2b0b2a5332d5c91.jpg_srz_p_324_182_75_22_0.50_1.20_0.00_jpg_srz

**Soul Tone is multi-dimensional energy & sound healing**

We ALL channel Source - yes all of us can and do!

As part of her life and soul's purpose, Nicol brings to you Source in the form of sound, energy and light language. Nicol is simply a guide and mirror to your true 'self' - the Source within You! 

'I am simply a guide on a jounrey to meet your highest self (source) in a 'space' that allows for deep healing and alignment of your truth.  Helping you Remember who you truely are and why you are here now! Nicol

Soul Tone  is a combination of guided meditation, sound, and light language offered in individual and group sessions to assit you in aligning to and integrating with Your Life / Soul's Plan.

Powerful LIVE Soul Tone Groups

• Deepen your awareness & heighten your consciousness. 

• Increase healing energy and Source to flow through you.

• Awaken and bring forth your innate healing gifts and tools.

• Awaken your DNA & soul's blueprint according to your life/soul plan

• Confirm that you are not alone and you are not going 'crazy'! 

• Energetically supports you on your journey - regardless of where you are at!

• Supports you in living a more peaceful and joyous life - on your terms!

Experience a powerful and healing Soul Tone  group and

Experience Source:Experience You!

$10 each group

Meeting each Wednesday in August - days will change in September!

What to experience in a group...

Nicol will lead the group through breathing and relaxing into a deeping state of awareness.  Source will come through the words, sounds and tones as the group receives healing.  Light language will support the process as keys, codes and frequencies of light are channeled in to support the individual as well as group.  As guided by Source, Nicol will personally connect with each participant and share a unique individual Soul Tone to help you clear, align and receive the gifts of your own Soul - Resonating with your Soul and Remembering who you are!

Many feel the energies 'highten' as we allow our selves to dissolve into the multidimensional aspects of self - of Source - connecting to us to the onesness and allness that we are - to the multidimensional beings that we are.  Many share the experiences of...lightness, stillness, peace, releasing, tingling, answers to questions and healing of unresolved issues.  And others simply enjoy the quiet time of relaxation and experience nothing more than that! 

Nicol is the co-creator of Soul Tone...

In co-creation with Source, Nicol is the only one doing this specific work at this time!  And it is profoundly evolving at a rapid rate! 

Yes, others may be doing similar type groups, workshops and sessions...and yes we are all working with Source, Spirit, Universal Energy or even God some may call it!  It is Nicol's innate gift to share with you on your path!

Nicol has been in this field for over 15 years and has completely opened and surrendered to her Life/Soul's Plan and in that surrendering has received this gift to share with you! 

And more about all this and more at Essence of Healing here!

http://www.thegoldenchickpeacenter.com

At The Golden Chickpea Center, we provide a warm and friendly atmosphere with emotional and social support in Brookline Village. Our main objective is to strengthen the initial emotional bond between families and their children in the community, particularly those who have no other family in the area.

In a cosmopolitan city such as Boston where young families come from many parts of the country and the world, due to education and professional opportunities, being far away from family is a common occurrence. Our center is a great alternative to fill this need.

We aim to be the premiere urban destination for cosmopolitan families with young children to socialize, have fun, and experience the richness of different cultures among us.

 Our Center is a welcoming place for families of all compositions and backgrounds where children and parents can learn, play and grow together creating shared experiences that last a lifetime... 


If you are one of those  families, join us,  you will feel at home!

results.description:
Our topic this month is First Impressions.

It doesn't matter whether you are speaking to a group of 1, 10, 100, 500, your first impression will make a difference in whether that group is going to listen to you or not.

It doesn't matter if you are giving a formal presentation, a sales presentation, a workshop, your elevator pitch, or just having a conversation. How you present yourself from the start can have a profound impact on how your "speech" will be perceived.

How Monthly Practice Sessions Work

The intent of these sessions is to provide a safe, comfortable, informal place for you to gain confidence and practice with speaking.

YOU DO NOT NEED TO BE PREPARED TO ATTEND THESE MEETINGS. They are meant to help you become prepared.


Each attendee will get a chance to head to the front of the room and practice a speech if you so desire and feel you are ready. The speech can be your elevator pitch, a portion of a prepared speech, a speech prepared just for these sessions, or an impromptu speech. You are also welcome to just come and learn from other attendees.


The limit of each individual presentation is determined by the number of participants for that session (generally under 10 minutes).
results.name: Monthly Speaking Practice Session

During our upcoming webinar, “How to Become a Leader in Your Startup Community,” we will outline the different resources needed to bolster your local ecosystem, and provide tips on how you can help startups and become a better startup mentor and advisor.

results.description:
$20 to attend. Please be on time and sign up only if you're positive you can be present.


In this workshop we'll read your work and give you constructive suggestions to strengthen it. From larger structural and character considerations to minor formatting and story bumps, we'll help you make your script tighter, evocative, and more compelling. 


Please bring at least four copies of ONE of the following:

1. Ten pages of an original feature screenplay (or a ten or less-page short film) that you wrote yourself.
2. A treatment that you wrote yourself (one to two-page synopsis of the plot) for a proposed original screenplay. Please keep treatments to two pages maximum.


If you haven't written a script or treatment, then come with your questions and a willingness to provide constructive feedback for others.


Regardless of what you bring, be sure to PRINT OUT COPIES so that we can read it together. If you don't print them out, we'll have no way to workshop your work! At least four would be appreciated.

If you haven't written a screenplay or treatment but are curious about the process, then we definitely have a place for you. For beginners, we highly recommend grabbing a copy of The Complete Screenwriter's Manual (http://www.amazon.com/Complete-Screenwriters-Manual-Comprehensive-Reference/dp/0321397932) and screenwriting software (free: CeltX.com, more features: FinalDraft.com)

For more personalized script attention, I offer one-on-one screenplay coverage services. Details and testimonials: http://www.screenplay.guru. 10% off for Cambridge Screenwriting members.

We can't wait to see you!
results.name: Group Screenplay Workshop - $20

Couch to 5K Fall Group
Interested in getting in shape but don’t know where to begin? Want to meet s

We have 2 groups:

1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K.
2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us.

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace.

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week.

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Stow Gobbler on Thanksgiving morning.

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group.

Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising.

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

results.description:
NEXT LEVEL BUSINESS FORUM brings together business-owners, -coaches, and -service-providers, for enlightened discussions. Each participant, expert in his own field, benefits from the others’ perspectives.

Last week, we brought together coaches and entrepreneurs in group coaching/consulting encounters, with insights later shared to everyone’s benefit.  It was so successful (by acclamation), that this week we will continue this process.

You’ll work with coaches in the room to define what next level looks like and discover steps to get there!

See more details in the agenda below.

--

GETTING HERE

Join us at MIT's Cambridge Innovation Center, 1 Broadway, Cambridge, 5th floor, Cozumel Room

• Register as a guest at the front desk and mention that you're attending our event on the 5th floor.

• Optionally: Meet us at Venture Cafe for networking before the event. Venture Cafe serves as a physical nexus for helping innovators and entrepreneurs find one another and collaborate to bring their dreams to reality.  All attendees to the Cafe should adhere to the Venture Cafe contributor model (http://vencaf.org/thursdaycafeboston/contributor-model/) and credo (http://vencaf.org/credo/). Learn more here: vencaf.org.

--


QUESTIONS? NEED HELP?

- Contact Ian: [masked], call or text: (802)[masked]

- Look for the Gain Street sign or anyone wearing a green Gain Street T-shirt in the Venture Cafe before our event


--

AGENDA

5 pm - Optional networking at Venture Cafe

*Venture Cafe is a members-only club for innovators. Learn more here: vencaf.org


6 pm - FREE PIZZA - Gain Street's Next Level Business Forum

Follow signs to the Cozumel Room on the 5th floor.

Need help getting here? Contact [masked], call or text: (802)[masked]

1. Intros

2. Getting together with a coach to ascertain and define what “the next level” of business means in that business’ own context.  Defining that “Level” will determine the best next steps to get there!

3. Describe obstacles and arrive at solutions 

--


REQUESTS & FEEDBACK - [masked]


Let us know what you want most from this group! We’d love to hear your ideas about how we can use our resources to help businesses get to the next level.

--


GAIN STREET


Have you heard about Gain Street??

results.description:
Our speaker on Advanced PowerShell Techniques: Making Azure PowerShell Awesome is Dan Stolts (the @itproguru), Chief Technology Strategist for Microsoft, and a fixture on the Boston technology community for a long time. 

Dan has so much to share that we decided to dedicate the entire event to this single topic.

• 6:00 PM - gather, have pizza

• 6:30 PM - Dan Stolts presents: Advanced PowerShell Techniques: Making Azure PowerShell Awesome 


• 8:15 PM - announcements, give-aways, wrap-up

• 8:30 PM - end


ABSTRACT: Advanced PowerShell Techniques: Making Azure PowerShell AWESOME! Learn some advanced capabilities within PowerShell. You may have been told that you can't: Change RemoteExecutionPolicy, Collect Data from User through a GUI, Generate Computer Certificates, and more with PowerShell. The reality is you can do this and much, much more. Come to this session to learn advanced techniques for bringing your PowerShell to life with pop-up GUI dialogs, effective and high performance loops and more. To be clear, this is not a getting started with PowerShell class! It is a demo heavy deep dive. You will learn much about PowerShell and more importantly PowerShell for Azure.  As a result of this session, you will be able to build your own 3 machine lab with PowerShell in only 15 minutes. All scripts used in presentation will be made available so you can "Leverage" the POWER in PowerShell!

Brought to you by ITProGuru - Dan Stolts - @itproguru - ITProGuru.com blog

ABOUT OUR SPEAKER

Dan Stolts “ITProGuru” is a technology expert who is a master of systems management and security and is Chief Technology Strategist for Microsoft. Reach him on his primary blog http://itproguru.com or twitter @ITProGuru. He is proficient in many datacenter technologies (Windows Server, System Center, Virtualization, Cloud, Etc) and holds many certifications including MCT, MCITP, MCSE, TS, etc. Dan is currently specializing in system management, virtualization and cloud technologies. Dan is and has been a very active member of the user group community. Dan is an enthusiastic advocate of technology and is passionate about helping others. See more at: http://itproguru.com/about.
results.name: Advanced PowerShell Techniques: Making Azure PowerShell AWESOME

To participate, please RSVP here, and arrive bearing enough copies of the text you’d like to discuss – whether prose or verse – for each participant to have their own. If you do not have the means to make copies of your writing, send the text by attachment to bostonpoetryunion (at) gmail (dot) com not later than the night before the workshop.

Occasionally, the moderator will invite a member or guest speaker to open the session with a brief talk on some literary topic. If you’re interested in delivering such a talk, email the organizers and let them know! Likewise let us know if you’d like to suggest a writing exercise or event.

Oscar Blumberg [@carnaval on GitHub] is a Master's student at the École Normale Supérieure in France, and the author of Julia's current generational garbage collector, used in Julia v0.4.

Oscar will introduce the garbage collector in Julia, explaining how it works and how understanding its behavior is crucial to understanding the performance of Julia code.

Lightning talks

Have a Julia usage story? Tried Julia recently and discovered some interesting things? Tell us about it! 

How to get here

The Star Conference room is on the 4th floor of the Dreyfoos Wing in the Stata Center (Building 32). Enter Building 32 at the front entrance and proceed straight ahead; there will be elevators to the right. Take the elevators to the 4th floor; exit to the left and then turn right at the end of the elevator bank. At the end of the short corridor, turn right, just before the R&D Dining room. The Star Conference Room is straight ahead, just past a set of stairs.


If you are visiting from outside MIT, please note that the doors lock promptly at 6pm. Do allow extra time to arrive earlier.

This month we have two presentations.

Marya will present: Node.js pros and cons.

"Maybe you're using node.js because your job requires it, or maybe you are learning it just for fun. There are good reasons to use node, but there are some downsides too. This talk will describe some pluses and minuses of the platform."

Gary will present: An Overview of TypeScript.

"TypeScript lets you write JavaScript the way you really want to. TypeScript is a typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript. Any browser. Any host. Any OS. Open Source."

We'll spend remaining time on NodeSchool, general JavaScript discussions, and networking.

• Pizza will be served.

• Directions
results.name: Node.js Pros & Cons - Overview of TypeScript - NodeSchool and networking.

results.description:
Please join us in Weymouth as we celebrate our ninth anniversary as a group!

Peppercornz is a spot that we have used before as a group, and a favorite of many people in the area. We'd love to have you with us as we catch up with old friends, make new ones, and talk about what's ahead!


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Peppercornz on Main
Thursday, August 27th, 2015 @ 6:30 PM
 1037 Main St (Routh 18)
Weymouth, MA
[masked]
Website: Peppercornz


Organizer: Mike

Min/Max: No max at this time.

Guests: Yes. Up to two per member.

• Price Range: On the low end, there are a number of entrees priced from $15.00 - $17.00.  A few dishes run as high as $23.00. Check out their online menu.


Cash Only Policy: Please bring cash! Paying for all of our meals in cash has been SSDOMG'S policy for over eight years. It allows us to avoid the confusion of having the waitstaff run multiple credit card slips and generally helps to keep things simpler for everyone.

Event Fee: As is traditional at our anniversary dinners, we are not charging a fee for this event. Pay only for what you order.

RSVP Deadline: Wednesday, August 26th, at 7:00 PM.

No-Show Policy: We have updated and greatly simplified our no-show policy. People who RSVP "Yes" to events are expected to exercise common sense and common courtesy. That means making your best effort to keep any commitments that you make, but if necessary doing your best to notify the Event Organizer or (preferably, if it's the day of the event) the venue if something comes up after the RSVP deadline. If you find yourself unable to either attend an event that you've RSVPed "Yes" to and are unable to either change your RSVP or let the venue know, please do contact the Event Organizer when you're able to, just to let us know that you're okay and that you're still interested in attending events.

Failure to do the above may result in your removal from the group at the Group Organizer's discretion.

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers,

This event will be the last one in the ICA free Harborwalk Sounds summer concert series! Grab a snack from our delicious summer menu and hit the galleries for free to make an entire evening of it.

http://www.icaboston.org/programs/ICA_Summer/

Admission to the museum is also free!

The concert takes place in the rear of the building, the back entrance to the museum.  There are a series of steps and a wide-space area where the musicians set-up their stage.  These steps face the water and have a gorgeous view of the Boston harbor. 

For meeting purposes, lets meet at the bottom (front-row), center  of the steps at 6:30pm. 

Remember, follow the WATER and to go to FRONT ROW, CENTER.  I will try to hold a Meetup sign to help you find the group.

Just a reminder, this is an actual meet-up event, not an advertisement. Please only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending and intend to meet members of the group. If you reserve "YES", we will be expecting you.  If you reserve "YES" and then have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.  A consistent history of not showing up for events may cause you to be removed from the group. 

I look forward in enjoying this event with the group.

Joana

******************************************

Directions and Public Transportation

If you are traveling via public transportation, the nearest T stop is the Waterfront on the Silver Line, http://www.icaboston.org/visit/directions-and-parking/public-transport/

For driving directions, please refer to http://www.icaboston.org/visit/directions-and-parking/

******************************************

Concert Details

Iris Lune

Blog Allston Pudding described the otherworldly indie-rock band Iris Lune as “a change of pace in Boston rock, and a sound that’s worthy of your attention.” Lead singer Ella Joy Meir croons mystically and melancholically along to dreamy, expansive alt-rock that crescendos and builds into a brazen anthem. New single “Bring Me to the Moon” confirms their influences, namely Radiohead, Björk, and Bon Iver.

http://www.icaboston.org/programs/performance/music/harborwalk-sounds2015/iris_lune/
results.name: ICA - Harborwalk Sounds Concert!  Iris Lune! Last Event of the Year! Free!

.

This event was founded by Boston Herald Columnist Steve Buckley.

See facebook and the site for details:[url=http://www.oldtimebaseball.com/] and updates.

<a>http://www.oldtimebaseball.com/[/url</a>;].

The 22nd Annual Old Time Baseball Game will take place on Thursday, August 27 at 7pm in St. Peters Field North Cambridge. What makes the Old Time Baseball Game so special is its dazzling collections of old uniforms that represent virtually every era in baseball history. The game offers a glimpse of what it was like in the old days. This years game is being played as a benefit for The National Technical Institute for the Deaf. Admission is free. Food and memorabilia will be available for purchase. Fans are asked to bring a lawn chair and camp out along the foul lines.

Former Red Sox infielder Lou Merloni and pitcher Lim Lonborg will participate in the game.

Donations are welcome.

Allow extra time for commute and parking as this event draws a huge crowd.
results.name: Old Time Baseball Game at St. Peter's Field, North Cambridge

results.description:
Over the past few weeks, Black Lives Matter activists have disrupted multiple campaign events for Bernie Sanders. Even as the protesters have successfully gotten multiple campaigns to release racial justice platforms and managed to bring racist police violence once again to the forefront of the national conversation, white progressives have continually asked...why Bernie? In this meetup, we’ll discuss racism by white progressives, leftists and liberals especially in how poorly Bernie Sanders supporters have responded to Black Lives Matter protests.

Suggested readings:

• Interrupting Bernie: Exposing the White Supremacy of the American Left

• #BlackLivesMatter More Than the Hurt Feelings of White Progressives™


• An Open Letter to Bernie Sanders Supporters

Accessibility Information: Pappenheim Library at Community Change, Inc. is wheelchair accessible with the following limitations.  The door to the building is heavy and does not have a button to open it. The elevator doors are slightly more than 30 inches wide.  The sixth floor bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible, but the first floor bathroom is.  During regular hours there are usually two tables in the library which limit mobility, but these are normally moved elsewhere during Knapsack events.  Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.
results.how_to_find_us: When you get to 14 Beacon Street, dial # and 19 (this will call the phone and we will buzz you in). Go to the 6th floor (you can either take the elevator up or walk up the stairs). The meeting will be held in the Yvonne Pappenheim Library.
results.name: How can I be racist? I'm voting for Bernie Sanders!

results.description:
The group in this meetup will be meeting twice a month and I want to do one of the meetups each month about a controversial film topic. These discussions don't need you to see a specific film but really see any of the number of films listed below. If there is a movie you haven't seen on the list I would recommend seeing it but you will be able to participate without having seen everything!

This meetup's topic will be Racial Cross Casting. I listed a couple of films that have done this. I tried to do different types of racial cross casting so we can talk about how we feel in each case. If you know of more films then add to the list of films in the comments!

The Conqueror
Cleopatra
Breakfast at Tiffany's
Highlander (Sean Connery)
The Jungle Book (1994 film Jason Scott Lee)
Tropic Thunder (Robert Downy Jr making fun of it)
A Beautiful Mind (IRL Wife was an Salvadorian)
21 (IRL Main Character was Asian Americans)
A Mighty Heart (IRL Mariane Pearl is Afro-Chinese-Cuban/Dutch)
Memoirs Of A Geisha (Chinese actresses instead of Japanese)
The Last Airbender
Lone Ranger (Johnny Depp)
Star Trek Into the Darkness (Khan)
Hunger Games (Cinna, Thresh and Rue)
Exodus (All lead Actors)
Aloha (Emma Stone) 

Upcoming Peter Pan film (Mara as Tiger Lily)
results.name: Controversial Film Topic: Racial Cross Casting

Tonight's presentation is sponsored by RIFT.io.

Twisted is a comprehensive networking framework built on asynchronous principles.  Node.js and other tools have made async I/O all the rage, but Twisted was there first.  Come learn about this extensive networking toolkit.

Patrick Cloke and Stephen DiCato will present. Starting from the very basics of asynchronous I/O, they'll explain how Twisted works, how to build simple services, and how to integrate Twisted with other services.

Pizza is provided by RIFT.io.

Drinks afterward at Meadhall, sponsored by Jana.

results.description:
Yes, it’s that time again—BostonJS is nearly upon us. Like the solstice, like the tides, like the fact that a misplaced semicolon was the thing causing that inexplicable error: we are nothing if not predictable.

As JavaScript-minded meetup organizers, we sometimes find ourselves struggling with the concepts of both time and math—so much so, in fact, that our last few events have run a little long. As a result, we’re trying a slightly different format: instead of three speakers, we’re gonna give two speakers a shot.

Sponsor-wise, New Relic is back again this month! 

New Relic is a software analytics company that makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications in real time. We’ve used it here at Bocoup and we’ve used it on the jQuery project, and we’re fans.

Adding 3D Functionality to Your Web Applications

Kevin Vandecar


We’ve all seen the web transition from a mostly text to an increasingly rich 2D image environment over the last few years – but now the shift to 3D is here. Enabled by web standards and open source technologies like WebGL, X3DOM, GLAM, and Three.js, and commercial tools from companies like Unity, Autodesk and Goo Technologies creating stunning engaging 3D web sites has gone from “for rocket scientists only” to “mere mortals”. ADN team from Autodesk will show finalists of 3D Web Festival in San Francisco and then demo server/client samples for our own View & Data web service and talk the group through a Quick Start Guide of how to implement your own 3D model on the Web using Server and Client side API’s covering.


Packing Webapps with Webpack

Z Goddard

An introduction to the deep feature set of webpack, a module loader. Build smaller, smarter scripts that can better incorporate your dependencies from other scripts to template, css, and binary files like images. Try faster css changes with hot swapped modules. Use a system that can vertically build your app or configure it for the parts you want it to handle.

And there you have it: our two (2) speakers for the evening. 

I think the new format will work out a little better, personally. Last time we all managed to get out of here at—what—nine thirty? Don’t get me wrong: that’d be fine, if my dog didn’t need to go out by quarter-to-`NaN` at the late— Wait. That’s not right. Quarter to `Infinity`? Uh… Hm. Well. My own fault for naming him “Zero,” I guess.

I’ll file a bug.

P.S.: Have I mentioned that you should speak at BostonJS? You should really speak at BostonJS.
results.name: BostonJS: Math.max: Fury Code
