results.description:
Join us every Sunday at Minibar boston. While there is no cover to attend this night, attendance is strictly RSVP only. Please find the link to RSVP below. Take a moment to reserve a free ticket today via eventbrite. 

Network and meet with sophisticated international young professionals. For over 3 years now, International Sundays has attracted local socialites, fashion enthusiasts, and some of the city's most up beat crowd. Music genres rotate on a weekly basis, where International Sundays morphs into a Salsa night, EDM night, Mediterranean Night, etc. That said, the evening features some of Boston's finest and most versatile DJs. Whether youre looking to network, dance or play this night is a night you dont want to miss. 

Details:


- Upscale dress code


- RSVP admission only; no cover 


- Dinner menu available till 11pm 


- For further info or table reservations contact the event executive directly @ 

Link to RSVP: 

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/international-sundays-tickets-

 


* each guest must have their own RSVP. 


* Groups of 5 or more are encouraged to contact the Events Executive to hear more about Exclusive Table Package Deals.
results.name: International Sundays at Minibar

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

Fitness doesn’t need to be intimidating or extreme, but it does need to produce good RESULTS! Come join TFW Boston for an after-work happy hour… errr I mean workout.

What to expect: 

• A challenging, motivating and downright fun environment for training - perfect for after a long work day. 

• Experience the Training For Warriors ‘Hurricane’ workout as seen on ESPN, The New York Times, and Boston Fitness Magazine, and has created world champions in multiple professional sports


• Effective warm-ups to ensure all participants perform optimally and remain injury-free. 

• Sweat, smiles, and lots of high-fives. 

What NOT to expect: 

• Bootcamp instructors barking in your face. 

• Workouts that put exhaustion before results and safety.


• Participants that are there just to feel like they’re better than someone else.

If you want to lose fat or build muscle, build strength, improve confidence and overall health, this is the place to be. Please bring water, workout clothes and shoes, a hand to high-five with, and a friend(if you’d like)

results.description:
Law of Attraction Book Club is a meet up for positive, optimistic women looking to share ideas and thoughts in a friendly and open setting.

We will discuss Secrets about Life Every Woman Should Know: Ten Principles for Total Emotional and Spiritual Fulfillment by Barbara De Angelis.

 Introduction and Chapters 1-5 will be discussed this month

Barbara De Angelis is a favorite among several of the group so we wanted to read one of her books. 

‘In Secrets about Life Every Woman Should Know, Barbara De Angelis, one of the nation's premier relationships experts, turns her attention to the most important relationship a woman could ever have: the one with herself. In this remarkable blend of timeless wisdom and practical advice, De Angelis presents ten profound secrets for creating the kind of true freedom we all seek--the freedom that comes from knowing how to stop sabotaging our happiness, how to tap into an inner state of confidence, clarity, and peace, and ultimately how to protect that state from life's many ups and downs. Whether you're longing for more calm in a too-busy life, searching for the inner confidence and self-esteem you've been lacking to manifest your dreams, or seeking more emotional stability and deeper spiritual discovery, these secrets will guide you on the next phase of your own very personal journey toward wholeness.’

Join us on the journey

No perfumes please we have members with allergies.

There is no charge for this event, however to use there room it is a requirement that EVERYONE that attends order food, I can't stress this enough, the restaurant is in business to make $$ and provide a service.  We are free to use their party room at no charge if we purchase food.  Please be respectful to this request

results.description:
New:

Due to time constraints and the game being very adjustable to new players joining and leaving at any time, I am making a change.

I do wish people to get something to compensate IHOP for letting us use the space, however, if you have not started or finished eating by 7:15pm please, start or finish eating at another table. The rest of the people will clean the table and start playing.  I want the rest of the players to have a chance to finish a game.


The rules give new players the opportunity to join the game at the start of any new hand, with the score of the mean player.

I am trying to keep the game and conversation balanced for everyone.  If multiple players are eating, conversing and playing,  the game may be held up until some people are restless.

Also, the more people eating and playing while handling the cards, the greater chance the few decks of "Jumbo Index" cards used for Negation Hearts will be marked and hard to shuffle, detracting from the game.

As always, please put your cold drinks on a napkin.

Thank you;

Negation Hearts Night. New players are VERY welcome: We will teach you how to play.

It is suggested that you get a drink or something else there, to compensate the hosting establishment. .

PUBLIC:

Both: The 450 and 456 Buses have nearby stops. 

Negation Hearts is played with two decks of cards. Two of the same cards like two king of clubs negate and the next highest card of the suit lead takes the cards played. So, even playing a two has not been safe at times. The scoring and passing are slightly altered from "Cancellation" hearts so that new people can join in or leave at the start of any hand.

The 50 cent charge is totally voluntary and is only to approximately cover the meetup charge.

This is SOCIAL CARDS conversation is encouraged, however please be aware of when it is your turn to play a card, we try to keep the fun balanced between the two.
results.name: Negation Hearts in Salem @ IHOP *

results.description:
Agenda 

• 6:30: Networking & Refreshments

• 7:00: Opening Remarks and Presentations

7 Ways to Turn Your Company Website Into a Lead Magnet


Christina Inge

You have a great website — except, where are the customers? If your website is not generating leads for you, learn how to get more customers than ever with these simple hacks. We’ll look at the latest developments in mobile, SEO, and conversion optimization to help your business website get you leads. Whether you’re a freelance consultant or working for a small business, this practical session outlines 7 simple tweaks to bring in the traffic, get people to contact you, and generate business from your site.


Christina Inge is the founder of Sleek Marketing University, Boston’s leading source of do-it-yourself marketing ideas and training for small businesses. Christina Inge is a digital marketing strategist with over 15 years’ experience. She’s helped a variety of organizations from Fortune 100 to nonprofits and startups hone their message and increase their conversions. Her areas of specialty include user experience, web analytics, and social media. She’s served as the VP of Social Media for AMA Boston, where she grew the online community to one of the largest for marketers in the US and is an adjunct professor of marketing at New England College of Business.


Ending WordPress Database Performance Issues Once and For All

Mike Skubisz will discuss the benefits of the adaptive DB vs. the traditional, and the increased performance an adaptive option can provide for a WordPress instance.


Mike Skubisz is the VP of Product Management at Deep Information Sciences. He has a strong history in technology, with experience across multiple industries including database, enterprise data communications, telecommunications access equipment, and OSS software. He is very familiar with the challenges faced both by start-up’s as well as established Fortune 500 companies.

results.description: Intersecting, overlapping, not-quite-what-they-seem lives. Jealousies and betrayals and wounded hearts. A haunting unease that clutches and won’t let go. All this and more helps propel Paula Hawkins’s addictive debut into a new stratum of the psychological thriller genre. At times, I couldn’t help but think: Hitchcockian. From the opening line, the reader knows what they’re in for: “She’s buried beneath a silver birch tree, down towards the old train tracks…” But Hawkins teases out the mystery with a veteran’s finesse. The “girl on the train” is Rachel, who commutes into London and back each day, rolling past the backyard of a happy-looking couple she names Jess and Jason. Then one day Rachel sees “Jess” kissing another man. The day after that, Jess goes missing. The story is told from three character’s not-to-be-trusted perspectives: Rachel, who mourns the loss of her former life with the help of canned gin and tonics; Megan (aka Jess); and Anna, Rachel’s ex-husband’s wife, who happens to be Jess/Megan’s neighbor. Rachel’s voyeuristic yearning for the seemingly idyllic life of Jess and Jason lures her closer and closer to the investigation into Jess/Megan’s disappearance, and closer to a deeper understanding of who she really is. And who she isn’t. This is a book to be devoured. -Neal Thompson
results.name: LITERATURE & LIBATIONS - The Girl On The Train, by Paula Hawkins

results.description:
Join us for an introduction to this unique Japanese martial art. Participants will all get a chance to practice some basic movements, explore a bit of the underpinning philosophy, and experience seated meditation. In short, we will have fun together learning about this martial way, one unknown to many in the United States. 

Shorinji Kempo is a relatively new martial art. It was founded just after WWII as part of a Zen Buddhist practice. Today, while the martial art has been separated from the religion, the practice of Shorinji Kempo remains true to it's Zen Buddhist roots, with philosophy and meditation still integral to the study in the dojo of hard (punches, kicks and blocks) and soft techniques (releases, joint locks and throws).
results.name: Boston Shorinji Kempo Open Dojo Event

results.description:
Climbing MeetUp at MetroRock Gym in Everett. Toprope, sport leading, and bouldering available, including some tall walls up to 55 feet. Whether you're a new or experienced climber, join us for a fun and solid workout! We usually have people at all levels. Gym meetups are also a great way to make more friends for outdoor climbing. Plus Mondays are ladies night: discounted admission. If you'd like to lead climb, don't forget to bring your rope :)

*** If you are new to MetroRock Gym and/or climbing, please see the FAQ below. ***

Meet at the picnic tables near bouldering area (the one furthest from the cubbies if available) from 7 - 7:10 PM.  (NOTE: In the rare case the Event Host doesn't arrive within this time window, assume major traffic jam or other catastrophy, ask others nearby to find the group, make introductions, and go climb).  If arriving later, just come find us on the walls.  Hopefully you can recognize us, the event Host(s) (see RSVP list) from our profile pictures, and/or check the small Whiteboard near the bathrooms and water fountain, for a description of what we're wearing that day.

Full-access Day Pass:  $22.  Students, Military or Bouldering-Only Pass:  $18.  Mondays are Ladies Night:  Women's Pass $14 after 3 PM & also special class pricing.

For membership, gear rentals, and other programs and pricing available, or for directions, check the gym website:  http://www.metrorock.com/

Frequently Asked Questions for Newbies:

Q) How do I get to the gym?

A) See website for directions: http://www.metrorock.com/ If you're driving here for the first time, it can be tricky to find MetroRock Everett, especially in the dark! Use a GPS if possible. MetroRock is in a building opposite Boston Coach.   If you don't have a vehicle, the gym offers a shuttle service from nearby Wellington T Station; call the gym for schedule details.

Q) I've never climbed at MetroRock Gym before, what do I need to do?

A) You'll need to take and pass a belay test for rope climbing. There is a separate test for toproping and sport lead climbing. For toproping, if you are not confident you can tie a re-threaded figure-8 knot and double fisherman's backup knot and safely belay a climber using an ATC device, it is highly recommended you take the Level 1 Safety class. They will not allow you to climb on ropes without passing a belay test. Call MetroRock in advance to reserve your spot in the class, and ask them about any discounts or special prices they are offering. Also, you can rent basic climbing gear (harness, shoes, belay device, etc), if needed, at the gym.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the picnic tables near bouldering area (the one furthest from cubbies if available).

results.description:
2 Player Games, ANY Game (Previously X-Wing Miniatures)

An opportunity to play those two player games that we do not play on a regular (mostly euro?) boardgaming night.  

If we have an odd number of players, or if we just feel like it, yes, it is fine doing a 3, 4 or 5 player game as well. 

Q & A:

Q.  What types of games are played? 


Anything.  Bring anything that you think will gather enough interest.  Examples: Netrunner, Marvel Dice Masters, Memoir '44, Twilight Struggle, Few Acres of Snow or even chess if that is your thing.  Put other suggestions on the event comments.

Will try this format a couple of times to see how it goes.

Q.  Should I bring something? 
A.  If you want, bring a game you feel comfortable teaching. There will be pizza and sodas served, feel free to bring snacks or beverages to share or chip in $5 to $10 for the pizza/beverages in the pizza cup.


Q.  Until when do you play games?  Can I arrive later than 7pm? 
A.  Until the last game of the evening ends, usually past midnight.  Yes, you can arrive later than 7pm, but you may have to wait for a new game to start if you do.

Q.  I really want to play XYZ game, can we schedule it? 
A.  Some people ask for interest in a particular game on the event comments below.  This may be the way to make sure you get to play the game you want. 

Q. What About X-Wing?
A. If you noticed, this spot is filling up the time previously scheduled for X-Wing Miniatures 100pts - so... as you may have guessed, Randy and I will be setting up a couple of x-wing miniatures tables for those of us inclined towards that game but still want to make the event more inclusive to other game genres (it is not often the wife allows me to invite my friends to play games, so I better make the best use of the time).
results.how_to_find_us: Across from soccer field (that is the alternate parking spot if the driveway fills up).
results.name: 2 Player Games (including X-Wing Miniatures)

results.description:
A WALK IN THE WOODS

Cast: Robert Redford, Nick Nolte, Emma Thompson, Nick Offerman, Kristen Schaal, Mary Steenburgen

In this new comedy adventure, celebrated travel writer, Bill Bryson (Academy Award winner Robert Redford), instead of retiring to enjoy his loving and beautiful wife (Academy Award winner Emma Thompson), and large and happy family, challenges himself to hike the Appalachian Trail - 2,200 miles of America's most unspoiled, spectacular and rugged countryside from Georgia to Maine. The peace and tranquility he hopes to find, though, is anything but, once he agrees to being accompanied by the only person he can find willing to join him on the trek - his long lost and former friend Katz (Academy Award nominee Nick Nolte), a down-on-his-luck serial philanderer who, after a lifetime of relying on his charm and wits to keep one step ahead of the law - sees the trip as a way to sneak out of paying some debts and sneak into one last adventure before it's too late. The trouble is, the two have a completely different definition of the word, "adventure". Now they're about to find out that when you push yourself to the edge, the real fun begins.

In theaters September 2

http://www.walkinthewoodsmovie.com/

https://youtu.be/cOF2LIAp9bw
results.name: A Walk in the Woods (Monday August 31st - Boston)

Described as the very best and very worst of humanity's humor from the greatest card game on Earth. Come out and meet singles while trading laughs and testing your sarcasm by playing "Cards Against Humanity." If you're not easily offended and enjoy a good laugh - this is the perfect icebreaker! It's the best way to get rid of the butterflies and turn your night into social high gear.

For more information on the game, please visit <a>www.cardsagainsthumanity.com.</a>

You're bound to make a new friend, connection, or possible future date by just showing up. Also, don't forget to ask about our matchmaking services where you can meet more professional Boston singles outside of this event. 80% of first timers report that they are nervous only leading up to the event, so do not worry if this is your first time. Scenergy believes in an open environment where our hosts ensure you feel welcome, safe, and are having fun - we hope to see you there!

prepay at THIS LINK

results.description:
Welcome to our regular meetup!  We are a casual group of people who enjoy playing board games -- specifically, the kind of board games that make you think.  We play a variety of games, most of which are Euro style games of medium complexity.


This season, in addition to playing games, we will be raffling off a bunch of popular games!  There will be a raffle at each meetup.  Simply by showing up, you'll get a chance to win free games. The more often you come, the more entries you'll receive.

Our weekly meetup is in a TERRIFIC space for games steps from the Kendall Square T, with easy parking, and lots of room to spread out in.  Full directions are below.  The building door does get locked in the evening, but there is plenty of foot traffic in and out.  If you expect to arrive later than 8:30, send Tucker a message ahead of time, and we'll make sure someone is there to let you in.

Our meetups happen once a week (alternating Mondays and Wednesdays), from 7:00 pm until the last people leave (usually quite a few hours).

Our group has been running since 2007, and at this point we have a pretty large crowd of regulars.  A lot of people come once every few weeks, and RSVPs are appreciated but not required, so the RSVP list is often smaller than our actual attendance.  We expect about 30-45 people at most of our meetups.

We play whatever people bring, which typically includes a lot of Euros.  Here's a "tip of the iceberg" look at a few games that have been popular lately:

7 Wonders, Terra Mystica, Race for the Galaxy, Splendor, One Night Werewolf, Le Havre, Hansa Teutonica, Machi Koro, Concordia, Super Big Boggle


As you can see, there is some real variety.  A few of our regular attendees bring about 20-30 games between them, so there's always a lot to choose from.  But if you have a game you like, just bring it with you!

People new to Euros are very welcome.  But be aware that you are NOT likely to find traditional American games (like Monopoly, Sorry, Risk, or Poker); the heaviest strategy games (like 18xx or wargames); or pure abstract games (like Chess).

Finally, a note about Settlers of Catan and Carcassonne.  These are traditional "gateway games" that many people play when they first discover Euros.  Although you will occasionally find those games at our meetups, many of us have played them to death and have become more interested in games with a little more complexity to them.

OUTBOUND (from Boston / from Park Street)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the front of the train. Cross the street. (If you take the escalator up, turn around first to see the street.) After crossing, proceed behind the T entrance (perpendicular to Main Street).  Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

INBOUND (from Alewife / Porter / Harvard / Central)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the rear of the train. Take the stairs or elevator straight up. Proceed straight ahead (perpendicular to Main Street). Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

FROM BOSTON (or Memorial Drive)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading north (cross the river if coming from Boston).  Memorial Drive is the first cross street past the river; go past it.
2) Take the first right, onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the first right after Memorial Drive.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

FROM CAMBRIDGE (or points west)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading south.
2) Take a left onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the last left before Memorial Drive; there is a railroad crossing there.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

Once you enter, Room 119 is just past the stairs on the right. There is a suggested donation of $1.00 that goes towards site fees and party supplies.  (You will also receive extra raffle tickets any time you donate.)

Feel free to email with any questions -- we hope to see you at a meetup soon.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk a quarter of a block away from the Kendall T, in the opposite direction from the Marriott Plaza.  We're in the big building on your right (across from the parking lot).  When you enter, our room is just across the foyer and on your right.

results.description:
Happiness is an innate need of every person in this world. Our stressful lives doesn't allow us to be happy most of the times and we all want to get rid of this stress to be truly happy. 

This session dwells more on how to get rid of the stress, anxieties, worries of past and future and live life fully right this very moment. 


Come join us for this session and learn the secrets of how to lead a stress free life with practical breathing & meditation techniques and learn how to be truly happy.


This workshop is conducted by the Art of Ling foundation, a international non-profit organization that has been teaching meditation and yoga in over 153 countries, for last 35 years.

No prior meditation experience is required. 

All are welcome.

results.description:
(Please note: many of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending that it says on the Meetup site.)

About This Meditation Meetup

We sit in silence for around 45 minutes, followed by discussion for around 30 minutes or so. The silent sitting is interspersed with some meditation instruction, perhaps a brief reading, a little simple inquiry, exploration or movement. Sitting posture is relaxed, either on a meditation cushion or a bench. It's not a rigid practice- move whenever you need to!

We meet every Monday night, 7:30 pm at the Cambridge Friends Meeting House. The Friends Meeting House is located at 5 Longfellow Park, Cambridge, MA 02138 You can find a very good map here: <a href="http://www.fmcquaker.org/FMC-Map_2006.pdf" target="_blank"></a>

http://fmcquaker.org/about-friends-meeting-at-cambridge/directions/

Parking is available after 6:00 in the loop off of Brattle St. that leads to the Friend's House, and there is a small lot in back of the Friend's House for those with limited mobility. After that, parking is a little tricky in Cambridge (lots of "resident only" signs), but you will find available parking on Mount Auburn St. near Friend's House and on Brattle St. as you head away from Harvard Square.

Coming by the T is a great option, with the Friend's House being a lovely 15 minute walk out of Harvard Square.

If you find you are running late, come anyway! The format is very relaxed and open— anyone interested in contemplative practice is welcome!

 

About Open Awareness Meditation Group

At the heart of these meditation sessions is the silent exploration of what we refer to as Open Awareness. We all know what it means to feel closed, limited, vulnerable, or separate. What is it like to allow ourselves to return to our natural condition of openness, presence, non-separateness and ease? This is what we explore in our meetings.

We have been meeting for over a decade, and those who lead the meditations have known each other and been practicing together for many years. They have all deeply explored a variety of traditions— for some it has been the Tibetan Buddhist practices of Dzogchen or Mahamudra, for others it has been the Indian traditions of Yoga, or Advaita, or what is currently referred to as Nonduality (some popular examples of this are Francis Lucille, Rupert Spira, Eckhart Tolle and Adyashanti). 

However all of these traditions ultimately point to the same truth, the truth of our basic awareness or presence which is beyond any tradition, practice or teaching. This is the presence we share, and the presence we are, beyond words. This is what we explore in our meetings.

This group is unique in that there is no specific guiding teacher, lama, or guru. We all meet as equals to question, share, and inspire each other to explore the Open Awareness we most deeply are. The meetings are suitable for newcomers as well as experienced meditators, and all are very welcome.
results.name: Open Awareness Meditation Group Meetup

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
